bug.author: sanrahul
bug.summary: Request for tflite using Android NDK documentaion
bug.description:
Thank you for submitting a TensorFlow documentation issue. Per our GitHub policy, we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests, and build/installation issues on GitHub. The TensorFlow docs are open source! To get involved, read the documentation contributor guide: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs>https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue: https://groups.google.com/a/tensorflow.org/d/msg/discuss/sye03udicMI/sDr6MQvIDAAJ</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing): No resources anywhere about tflite usage using Android NDK.</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h3>Clear description</denchmark-h>
I have a .tflite model which involves lots of post processing. After following <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/lite/guide/inference#load_and_run_a_model_in_c>https://www.tensorflow.org/lite/guide/inference#load_and_run_a_model_in_c</denchmark-link> I have written the code in cpp and tested on linux and adb shell. Now I want to use this code in the sample Android apk .(<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/examples/tree/master/lite/examples/object_detection/android>https://github.com/tensorflow/examples/tree/master/lite/examples/object_detection/android</denchmark-link> ) Is there any documentation/sample usage of tflite cpp in Android? I have only found this(<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zimenglyu/TFLiteExample>https://github.com/zimenglyu/TFLiteExample</denchmark-link> ) but not able to follow this :( Any help would be desperately appreciated.

comments.comment:
Found this tf_world's tflite with cpp demo:: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/infil00p/tf_world>https://github.com/infil00p/tf_world</denchmark-link>
Will follow it and update.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sanrahul>@sanrahul</denchmark-link> Are you raising a PR to update the docs? When you raise a PR, just mention it here so that we will close after it gets merged. Thanks!
